document.id: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R19-018
document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R19-018
ANNUAL BUDGET AUTHORIZATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 2019-2020
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 21st day of June , 2019, the following Resolution was adopted:

recital.text: the Pueblo de San Ildefonso ("Pueblo') is a sovereign and self-governing Tribe, recognized as such by the United States of America; and

the voters of the Pueblo approved a Governing Agreement ("Agreement") for the Pueblo on November 19, 2011, and the Bureau of Indian Affairs approved the Agreement on December 21, 2011, pursuant to Federal law; and
the Council is authorized to make laws for the Pueblo pursuant to Section 5 of the Agreement; and
Section 5(a)(ii)(A) of the Agreement requires the Pueblo to enact an Annual Budget that includes all projected revenues and expenditures; and

the Pueblo's FY2019-2020 Annual Budget consists of three (3) fund types within the financial system: the General Fund that is the basic operating fund that accounts for everything not accounted for in another governmental fund; the Special Revenue Fund that is specific revenue fund sources that are limited to being used for a particular purpose; and the Capital Projects Fund for fund accounts for the construction, rehabilitation, and acquisition of capital assets, such as land, buildings, equipment, and roads; and
for budget purposes, revenues are defined as increases in financial resources received during the year to meet financial obligations incurred during the year; and

as part of fiscal responsibility the Council directs that programs, when both federal or other funding as well as General Funds are budgeted, utilize and exhaust outside sources of funding first before utilizing Tribal funds (General Fund); and
the Governor shall keep the Council informed of the Tribe's financial position by providing the Council with a monthly, written financial statement of the Pueblo; and

as part of the close fiscal monitoring of revenues, it is imperative that the Pueblo properly identify, record, and maximize use of revenues generated from long term right-of-way agreements for Pueblo property, and

the Governor's Office, in coordination with the Council Budget, Finance, and Taxation Committee, developed the proposed budget attached to this Resolution ("FY 2019-2020 Annual Budget") and recommends approval of the attached FY 2019-2020 Annual Budget as summarized below; and
the Council has reviewed the proposed FY 2019-2020 Annual Budget and the Budget, Finance, and Taxation Committee's recommendation to approve the Annual Budget.

para.text: Approves and enacts the attached FY 2019-2020 Annual Budget in the total amount of $09,048,766.00 effective July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2020; and
Directs that programs, when both federal or other funding as well as General Funds are budgeted, utilize and exhaust outside sources of funding first before utilizing Tribal funds (General Fund); and
Directs the Governor to provide the Council with a monthly report on the expenditure of budget funding; and
Directs the Governor to keep the Council informed of the Tribe's financial position by providing the Council with a monthly, written financial statement of the Pueblo; and
Directs that annually amortized revenues from right-of-way agreements be placed into a designated account and be drawn down annually for general fund purposes; and
Directs that Council approval shall be required for the allocation or usage of any and all unanticipated revenue or additional new funds received during the budget year.

Approves and adopts this resolution in accordance with the requirements of the Agreement, according to published Council procedures, and authorizes and directs the Governor or his designee to take such actions as deemed necessary to carry out the intent of this resolution.

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on June 21 , 2019, at a meeting with a vote of 6 in favor, 3 opposed, 1 abstaining and 0 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

attachment.heading: ANNUAL BUDGET AUTHORIZATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 2019-2020
attachment.text: Annual Budget including all program budgets is attached as a separate document.

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "ANNUAL BUDGET AUTHORIZATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 2019-2020."

para.text: "Agreement" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Governing Agreement.
"Council" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council.
"Governor" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso Governor.
"Pueblo" means the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this Act is to approve the Annual Budget for the Fiscal Year 2019-2020 (July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2020).

para.text: The government of the Pueblo operates on a limited budget.

Recently, the Pueblo has faced increased financial pressure as a result of several major, complex, high-stakes legal settlements and projects involving land, water, roads, and related issues, which are nearing completion.
The Council has taken steps to enact laws to increase efficiencies within the government and reduce costs by reorganizing Departments, creating new Departments, and reassigning duties.
The creation of the new Tewa Language Department will assist in establishing a permanent language program that could sustain itself while improving the delivery of services.

The creation of the new Project Management Department will decrease the Pueblo's dependence on outside consultants, advisors, and others and will improve institutional and governmental capacity to address long-term and consequential matters.
The reorganization of the government has created the need to adjust salaries and wages.

The increased demands on the discretionary funds of the Pueblo has also caused the Council to evaluate and modify the salaries and wages of Directors of Departments in order to promote fiscal responsibility
Approves and enacts the attached FY 2019-2020 Annual Budget in the total amount of $9,048,766.00 effective July 1, 2019 to June 30, 2020; and
Directs that programs, when both federal or other funding as well as General Funds are budgeted, utilize and exhaust outside sources of funding first before utilizing Tribal funds (General Fund); and
Directs the Governor to provide the Council with a monthly report on the expenditure of budget funding; and
Directs the Governor to keep the Council informed of the Tribe's financial position by providing the Council with a monthly, written financial statement of the Pueblo; and
Directs that annually amortized revenues from right-of-way agreements be placed into a designated account and be drawn down annually for general fund purposes; and
Directs that Council approval shall be required for the allocation or usage of any and all unanticipated revenue or additional new funds received during the budget year.

Approves and adopts this resolution in accordance with the requirements of the Agreement, according to published Council procedures, and authorizes and directs the Governor or his designee to take such actions as deemed necessary to carry out the intent of this resolution.

section.heading: Sovereign Immunity
section.text: Nothing in this Act waives the sovereign immunity of the Pueblo or any of its representatives, officers, or employees.

section.heading: Severability
section.text: If a court of competent jurisdiction finds any provision of this Budget to be invalid or illegal under applicable law, such provision shall be severed from this Budget and the remainder of this Budget shall remain in full force and effect.
